title: SoC PERF_ST 330-0-21 Topics in Performance Studies

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course stages a conversation among blackness, Latinadad and sexuality by examining the work of black and brown artists in the black diaspora. Using "Blacktino" as a framing device, the course will highlight how these artists index the specificities of black and brown social and political relations, while also waging a broader queer-of-color critique of institutionalized racism and homophobia. Students will engage these artitsts' work on various levels, including textual analysis, embodied experience, critical reception, and site-specific engagement.

*This class includes a mandatory experimental learning trip to New York City (May 26-29, 2017). Travel expenses will be subsidized for all enrolled students.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: To apply for registration permission, please email professors at e-johnson10@northwestern.edu and r-rivera-servera@northwestern.edu with no more than a 500-word statement expressing interest in the course, fit into your current undergraduate study plan, and detailing any relevant coursework already taken in advance of enrollment and relevant experience by no later than February 17th, 2017 @ 5pm. Applicants will be notified of admission by the opening of registration on February 20th.
